ygData.subject: Re: Dex
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, I believe GZ has admitted that dex does nothing in helping recovery from interruption by casters.  Recover from interruption is entirely based on the
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, I believe GZ has admitted that dex does
nothing in helping recovery from interruption by
casters. Recover from interruption is entirely based
on the channeling skill, contrary to what most casters
perceive.

On a side note people have asked whether the dex makes
a difference in missed notes. I do believe it does.
I went even from 124 or so to 112 and feel like I've
noticed a difference. This could be all in my head as
well. My missed notes, however, occur in bundles. It
is rarely one here and one there. It is usually 3-5
missed notes all in a group. Followed by relatively
long periods of no missed notes. So I'm thinking maby
my "bundles" just got bigger. Maybe before I would
have 1-3 missed notes in a row and now it is 3-5.
Just a thought.

Thex Luteslinger (Tunare)
40th level bard, Black Tower

> Message: 1
> Date: Thu, 18 May 2000 14:55:41 -0400
> From: "Kevin L. Crawford" <Lyrnia@...>
> Subject: Re: Blade of Fiery Lamentations
>
> Nope you're right. Dex does nothing for speed. All
> dex does is:
>
> 1) Affects dmg for bows
> 2) Affects dmg for thrown (not told but determined
> through experience)
> 3) Affects chance of crits/cripple
> 4) Increases chance of a weapon processing it's
> effect
> 5) Decreases song missed note rate
> 6) Helps casters recover from interruption
>
> Thats it
